concept.title: What are GitHub Pages?
concept.shortdesc: GitHub Pages is a free webhosting service offered by GitHub. GitHub Pages works with Jekyll websites, and with customized domains.

conbody.p: The official GitHub Pages documentation is available at https://pages.github.com/.

GitHub is a service and tool located at github.com. This service provides a place to upload computer files and keeps a history of the fileâ€™s changes. It is commonly used to store computer programs, but can also be used to store text and other documents. It is a popular service, used by over 4.5 million.
GitHub will host static webpages for free using a service called GitHub Pages. There is one website available per GitHub user. There is also one website per repository, known as a Project Page.
